Reviews.Title: “Hotel with cool cat”
Reviews.Author: atohabo
Reviews.Content: Location in very nice area of Paris,close to Saint Germain de Pres. Close to RER. Good but simple breakfast. Very well kept interior and fancy design. There is cool cat in the lobby, mostly what I saw sleeping, Though, I'm allergic to cats and didn't have any problems, ff you are very allergic to cats you may choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cembl
Reviews.Content: Took my aunt on her first visit to Paris to celebrate her 75th birthday so had to be sure to get the right location. This certainly was a great location for transport, eating out and feeling safe to walk about. The hotel room was very comfortable and clean and reception staff were always helpful. We enjoyed a good breakfast in the vaulted basement before setting out each day to see the sights. Free wi fi is available in the rooms or use the PC in the foyer. I would be happy to go back to this hotel if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: cjotter323
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, close to the Odeon metro, and just a short walk to the Luxembourg Gardens in a lovely area of Paris. We got a good deal with Railbookers, who I would recommend travelling with. The view from our bedroom window overlooked the roof, but it's all about the location in Paris and the price - both of which were great for a weekend in May. The breakfast was a simple continental affair in the cellar of the hotel, which was very nice. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. For a good value, clean, well located hotel in Paris, you can't wrong with the Saint Paul Rive Gauche.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shortroundj
Reviews.Content: Great location, great prices, nice rooms. Definitely a hard combo to find in Paris but Hotel St. Paul has them all. The owners are super nice and attentive. Rooms are small but I've never seen a big one in Paris even at the city's nicest hotels. Room decor is very cool - each room is a little different and uniquely designed. Boutique feel. Cool old building too.

Reviews.Title: “Average average average”
Reviews.Author: maxtedandlily
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a lot in this part of Paris and did not think I could be disappointed, but I am. There is nothing wrong with this hotel and the staff are very nice, but the reviews over rate this compared to others. It is not cheap, breakfast is not included nor can you make a cup of tea....all things you can do in nicer nearby hotels. So it was ok, but I will not be back. Check my other reviews for better hotels in same area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: MrsK72
Reviews.Content: We just returned back to the states after a week long stay in Paris at this hotel. The location was absolutely perfect for everything we wanted to see and do. It is within a neighborhood that we totally felt safe walking through anytime day or night. There were 3 fantastic places to eat and have coffee at at the end of the block. We would recommend Le Comptieur and Cafe Danton as well as les Edituers. We were also able to walk to Notre DAme, the Luxembourg gardens and theOdeon Metro stop was super easy The team that manages the front desk at the St Paul hotel was fantastic and were all extremely helpful with whatever questions we had on a daily basis. We thought the cat Skype was a very cute mascot for the hotel and made it feel even more cozy than it already was. I would totally rate this place a 5 out of 5 based on location, cleanliness and overall customer service. Well done! Thanks for helping to make our trip an awesome and memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Colourful, charming rooms. Terrific breakfast and Skype, the cat is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Louise01Australia
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. This is the second time my family has stayed here and if I travelled to Paris, I would come back to Hotel St Paul! We love the hotel's charm and quaint rooms. They are really cute and old world. The bathrooms are modern, very clean and bright. I had communicated with the staff frequently before our visit this time as we needed a restaurant booking for Christmas lunch and I couldn't leave it until we arrived in Paris. They were really helpful and found us an awesome restaurant nearby (Le Odeon?). The location of this hotel is convenient. We walked everywhere. There are good shops nearby, great restaurants, the underground at the end of the road. We love Skype, the cat. We felt at home with Puss around and it was an extra special memory for my ten year old becuase she was missing her animals from home. It is charming without being stuffy. It is friendly but professional. It has charm and you can feel at home here. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth at a Very Cold Time”
Reviews.Author: gcbcmgr
Reviews.Content: My second time to this lovely and unpretentious little gem. Paris was at its coldest, but the friendly hospitality and genuine kindess offered here will forever warm my heart. Unfortunately, I was here for medical reasons and I was treated so gently and with such care that I am humbled and revived by just being here. I can not say enough abut these very, very special people who I have had the great pleasure of getting to know. The room was well appointed and cleaned. Fellow guests were very pleasant, the overall atmosphere very positive and welcoming. A very special stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: djacobu
Reviews.Content: Typically, I stay in other parts of Paris. I decided to try the Left Bank for a change. I received a lot of referrals for hotels in the area. However, I preferred to look to Tripadvisor and found this great hotel. The hotel is located a few minutes walking distance from the RER B line. So, it was very easy to get to the hotel from the airport. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from one of the best intersections on St. Germain. This is an advantage as the street is quiet which contributes to a great sleep experience. There are great restaurants, bars etc within walking distance. One of my favorites restaurants, Le Comptoir, is just two short blocks away. The stafff was absolutely perfect. They were friendly, professional and just a pleasure to interact with. The gato is also very freindly! The rooms were very warm and a bit less traditional. They have open exposed beams and fabric wallpaper. They were very comfortable but not super fancy or modern, except the bathroom. This is a small place that makes you feel at home. The rates are great, especially given the area. If you are used to spending a fortune at the Ritz, go elsewhere. If you want a great eexperience in a great lcoation, look no further. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “17th-century Gem at the Heart of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: LaVoyageuse2012
Reviews.Content: I discovered Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche when traveling with my boyfriend and two friends in the late summer of 2010, and it will be my hotel of choice in Paris from now on. I adored the charm of the 17th-century hÃ´tel, with light stone walls and broad dark ceiling beams. The original character of the building was carefully preserved, but the bathrooms and fixtures were very modern and tidy, and there was wireless internet service as well. The bathroom was absolutely tiny, but hey, it's Paris. Our room was otherwise light and spacious, and featured excellent amenities. I found the self-serve breakfast generous and delicious, and the miniature pains au chocolat et pains aux raisins sustained me on our long treks throughout the city. The hotel's location can't be beat; we chose it because it lies on a quiet side street in the heart of the Latin Quarter, just minutes from the Luxembourg Garden, MusÃ©e de Cluny and the Boulevard St. Michel. The service at the hotel is excellent was well; the personnel treated us very kindly, even getting us into our rooms a little early, and gave us superb tips for local restaurants. For its price, location and quality, I wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche to any visitors to the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Charm & Great Value for Money in St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: LeahVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche and would happily stay again. The hotel is an excellent location (metro / walking distance to many attractions) but also in a quieter part of St Germain. The rooms have great Parisian charm but at the same time don't cost and arm and a leg. The staff are also incredibly helpful and welcoming. Here are also a couple of great recommendations - go to the wine shop on the corner! walk to Poilane or quite frankly there are a ton of delicious patisseries in the neighbourhood Le Comptior at the end of the hill is a fabulous place for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on location, price, and Skype the kitty. The location is perfect: a short walk to Luxembourg RER and Odeon metro, and certainly walkable to the Seine. The price was right - we got a package through the website that included breakfasts each day. You can take or leave the breakfast depending on your own preferences but we appreciated quickly filling up on hard-boiled eggs and croissants before heading out for the day. With the exchange rate being relatively more in our (the US's) favor recently, I found the hotel to be a bargain. Plus, we're not fancy pants hotel people; we like class & comfort without the poshness and blandness of major chains. We upgraded our room for the two of us and it was a great size! The high ceilings made it seem even larger. The bathrooms have been remodeled and the showers & hot water were excellent. The front desk was always helpful and gave us restaurant recommendations. The hotel is located near several good ones, and they'll make reservations on your behalf. The best part is Skype the kitty, friendly and funny. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donjmf
Reviews.Content: The location is great, in Saint Germain, with loads going on in an evening and very close to the Seine/ Louvre etc. Also less than 5 minutes from metro stations to take you anywhere you want to visit. Even better really easy to get to from CDG (take RER B to St-Michel and 5 mins walk) so no messing about with taxis/ metro if you have luggage. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, even though I had messed up my reservation they couldn't have been more helpful. The rooms are an ok size for small hotels in Paris and the bed comfortable. Bathroom not massive, but modern and bright with a really good shower. Not a place for late risers at the moment as noisy building work going on, but doesn't start until about 8.30. Only negative is the price, although you could do an awful lot worse in Paris, it wasn't cheap, but if price was right I would more than happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MWRVer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Saint Paul Gauche for two nights and it was just wonderful. the hotel is very charming and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The loctaion was perfect for us. We very much enjoyed walking and exploring the streets of Paris and this hotel served as a great starting and end point for us. Juts wonderful. Oh and the cat made it even better. Very cute! Thanks again Hotel Saint Paul and Paris for making a part of our Honeymoon very magical! - MWRVer.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: TopazMine
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel in a great location. Extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Resident cat a little skittish at times, but that was probably more to do with the renovations that began while we were there! (They're currently installing new security cameras in the hallways and upgrading the electrical wiring - so probably best to ring them and check when these are due to finish if you sleep light or are likely to want to sleep during local work hours). The sleep quality was great, and when my husband pointed out the toilet seat in our bathroom was cracked the staff got it fixed as soon as it was possible (we arrived late on Sunday, so it had to wait till Monday morning). The bathroom overall was very compact but well designed. Room safes could be a little bigger; they are the older type that can't fit laptops, although they would probably take an iPad. Staff were able to navigate us through the many Japanese eateries in the area to one that was really good, and they also helped us find a local cinema playing the movie we wanted to watch in English and work out what times it was showing. Breakfast was a good selection of yogurt, fruit, hams, pre-packed individual cheeses, very good local breads, and excellent pastries (although it is Paris so it's difficult to go wrong there!). The location was perfect for us. We could wander to most of the major sites from the hotel, and did so. L'ile du Nord is a leisurely 20 minute meander away. The Odeon is just down the end of the street. Sorbonne University is just around the corner so there are lots of eateries and bookshops aimed at students. There are many Japanese restaurants up and down the street the hotel is on, and if you have been travelling a while there is a self-service laundry directly opposite the hotel. Those with mobility problems need to take into account that the stairs are uneven and that in keeping with most of Paris there is only one tiny lift that was probably shoe-horned into an old service lift; it most definitely wouldn't take a mobility scooter for example. Those with allergies need to bear in mind that Skype (the cat) wanders about at will downstairs, and sleeps on the chairs in the snug (and also at one point on my scarf :-) I can't comment on the value as we booked this as part of a package so don't know the exact rates we paid. All in all one of the best places I have stayed in Paris over the last eleven years, and one to which I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: bajesma
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous Paris hotel reviews my wife and I chose this hotel for a five night stay. We were looking for somewhere quiet (we're very light sleepers) but convenient for the main sights of Paris. The Saint Paul Rive Guache seemed to be what we were looking for and, at the end of our stay, we felt that we had made a good choice. Our room (a 'classic' double) wasn't ideal but the location and staff made up for the room's minor shortcomings. When we arrived the reception staff were very helpful and cheerful and this was the case throughout the whole of our stay. They also spoke excellent English which was a real bonus as our French is quite minimal. Our room was on the third floor at the back of the hotel. It was quiet, small and had attractive old wooden beams across the ceiling. It could have done with a few licks of paint on the walls and cupboard doors. However, the bed was comfortable, everywhere was clean, there was a good sized wall mounted flat screen tv, minibar, safe and fridge. The view from the large windows looked out across a courtyard towards adjacent office buildings. The shower room was also small but had been recently renovated and had a really good shower. We didn't have the hotel breakfast priced at 13 Euros but chose to use the local cafes and shops instead...... The situation of the hotel, in the Luxembourg/Latin area, was just right for us. There are cafes, restaurants, shops and markets all close by. It is very convenient for the metro and buses and is only ten minutes walk to the city centre and the banks of the Seine. But, despite all the bustle, activity and convenience, the hotel was very quiet, situated as it is in a narrow street with very little noise. Maybe a 'superior' room would have made a difference, but no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, quality, service, location - Saint Paul Rive Gauche has it all!”
Reviews.Author: pisces0222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 9 nights at the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche. We were absolutely delighted with the hotel. We stayed in unit #1, a superior double room with a jacuzzi tub on the first floor. The location of the hotel in the heart of the Latin quarter and only a few blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens, Metro & RER stations couldn't have been better. The quality of the room was excellent - good size, nice bed with good linens and firm mattress, lovely jacuzzi tub. Our room rate included breakfast every morning and we found the quality and selection to be excellent. The front desk staff were incredibly warm, welcoming and helpful. They all spoke excellent english and were happy to recommend restaurants, point out the best way to get to various places we wanted to visit, etc. The resident cat Skype was darling and made us feel less lonesome for our own family cats. Overall great value, quality, and hospitality. I highly recommend this hotel for leisure travelers!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: kjhk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay in September. Nice hotel in good location, comfortable beds and nice and quiet at night with a nice breakfast provided in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “still my favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: thevagabond
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick two-night stay at the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche and it still has to be my favorite hotel in Paris. Two of us stayed on a top floor room with a bit of a view out over the rooftops of the Left Bank, while our friends with kids stayed in the very spacious family room, which is actually two rooms with twin beds in one, then a loft with the bath and a queen bed, great for families, and that's hard to find on the Left Bank. The location is just between the Sorbonne and the Senate, so an easy walk to all the great sights of the Left Bank, and maybe a ten minute stroll down to the banks of the Seine. I think the bathroom had been recently remodeled, and it was spotlessly clean, though typically small for a Left Bank hotel. The staff was cordial, friendly and helpful, and we delighted in coming home from a long day of sightseeing to be greeted by Skype the kitten, who is apparently the new hotel mascot. This place just oozes old Parisian charm, can't wait to go back and spend more time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in September and had a wonderful time. Staff were very friendly and we even met their lovely hotel cat;room small (which is apparent in most European cities l'm led to believe) was very clean, bedding lovely; bathroom functional; hotel is central to all facilities in Paris..walking distance to most places and if not it is easy to catch public transport; wonderful restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: casey0999
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay there in one of the larger double rooms, while traveling companions stays in a smaller double. Like virtually all hotels in Paris, the rooms are on the small side, but reasonably comfortable. Although we were on the street side, the noise was not bad due to the double glazed windows (although on Sat night, there was some noise from the hallway and adjacent rooms a few times) The internet works fine, although we constantly had to re-log in. The bathrooms were very modern and clean. Lots of hot water and water pressure. The bed was quite comfortable. All in all, a very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozwest59
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here in September. Fabulous hotel, fantastic location. Room was small but very nice, clean, comfy and had everything we wanted. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is walking distance to everywhere! Great restaurants nearby as well. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: DrDANT
Reviews.Content: First, realize the latin quarter and on the left bank, was left out of Haussmann's efforts, so it's jammed together and hotel rooms are tiny. Not a criticism of St. Paul per se, but the rooms ARE quite small--we had to sepecify a larger bed. Overall, charming place with a nice staff. One issue is that the internet there is rather sporatic and difficult--this may have been problems with their service, but I doubt it.. SIgnal gets dropped constantly and it's a pain to use because you must re-enter username/password continually, despite the hotel's suggestion they dont. They haver 2 services, but frankly, the only way to get internet reliably is to sit in their little lobby. While you don't go to Paris to sit on the internet, having service is imperative these days, so this is a major flaw--I dont know if all the other little charming hotels in the area (and there are many) have issues-but i suspect it's not up to USA standards. Despite that, the hotel was nice, clean, and quiet. The staff went out of their way to accommodate, including giving a discount and moved our room because of the internet problems (and moving didn't take care of the problem). And, their little cat, Skype, was very cute and fun to have around. The location is good and there are a many great restaurants in the area. I think the price is a bit high considering what we got, and higher than other hotels in the area that looked very nice, but I couldnt know if they were. I certainly would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: APMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Good location. Extremely friendly reception staff and very helful indeed (and spoke excellent english too). Rooms are small (like elsewhere in Paris), but given the ceiling hight and smart room planning it was still still very comfy. Bathroom equipment was new and working properly. Nice TV. Yes, prices a bit high (like elsewhere in Paris), but that's rather Paris problem than hotel's..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chappers98
Reviews.Content: Brought my sons and inlaws to Paris for a couple of nights and chose this hotel from the reviews. We were not disappointed. Friendly and helpful staff, but the best bit about it was the location. The rooms were small, but clean. My youngest son loved Skype, the cat! A little expensive, but you pay for location and it was perfect. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: dalmart
Reviews.Content: The staff were so pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. The room quiet and quaintly decorated with a lovely bathroom and shower and good space. The breakfast room was downstairs in a "monastery-like" space-again,beautifully decorated and the breakfast was more than adequate.The location was fantastic-a few minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens,Notre Dame, Boulevards St Germaine and St Michel and the Sorbonne- to name just a few. Restaurants were very close (one literally next door) . This hotel was the only one during our entire European vaction who offered free WiFi without asking and promptly gave us the access codes for all our i-phones and i-pads.We hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Sooo cute, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: newtx3
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this property starting with the welcoming staff, the charming room, the cellar dining area, and the terrific location. This hotel is by the Luxemburg gardens but also walking distance to the Notre Dame and Sorbonne. We actually walked to the Louvre and the Orsay from this hotel in just a few minutes. It is just a few blocks to main street and the Metro which we took everywhere in the city. Breakfast was always really good, for continental, served in an almost medieval setting in the cellar, nice touch there. The room key is given to the front desk to keep for you during the time that you are not in your room, it's way too bulky to put in your pocket. This way the staff can welcome you back when retrieving your key and not one of them had to ask us our room number after the first time of speaking to them - for our four day stay. They were also helpful with a map showing their location and sights to see. I think the only downfall of the hotel was the elevator. So happy they had one since we were on the top floor but it is only big enough to fit two people if your bags were large as ours were. Four people could fit but it would be very intimate. We always walked down the stairs to let others use the lift. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citikitty
Reviews.Content: Paris hotels can be hideous. Not this one. It's a bit of a gem. Quirky. Friendly. Good value. Incredibly well located. Don't expect luxury but equally don't fear the rooms being poor; they are good three star fare in an incredibly well located part of the Left Bank. The real strength though of this place is the friendly staff that work here, parti0ularly those on the front desk (one of the ladies who runs the breakfast room is much less so!). They cannot do enough for you. I thought their service rivalled any of the service from 4 star hotels on the rest of our trip. One slight reservation: the breakfast is a little ho-hum. Not bad (or anything like it) but just a little ordinary of somewhat limited choice. The croissant were a bit ordinary as were the pain au chocolat. Some of the bread -- particularly the nutted bread -- was lovely though. This aside, I hearily recommend this place. I will certainly make it our hotel of first choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location, easy to get to from CDG, hotel staff is friendly”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on recommendation from a friend and I was not disappointed. First hotel was very easy to find and easy to get to via the Luxembourg RER station which I took the train directly from CDG airport. Exit the station, cross the circle, and then take first left and you will see hotel sign a block away in distance. The hotel location is right next to the Odeon and Luxembourg Gardens. It is also a very easy 10-15 min walk to the Louvre and Orsay Museums. You are also a couple blocks away from the cafes and shops in St Germain area and then another easy 5-10 mins walk to both Notre Dame and Pantheon. Besides the location being terrific, the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel felt cozy instead of a business feel which I enjoyed. The hotel cat Skype was a delight as well. I had the breakfast on the last day, it was the typical breakfast you normally get in Paris with pastries and cold cuts and french bread. One more thing, the room has free wifi and AC which was nice in the middle of summer. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at Saint Paul and would stay again next time back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful in every way. Hope to return.”
Reviews.Author: PhilomelUK
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to go to Paris since I was 18 and am now in my seventies. Since I have recently been widowed, my son thought it was about time I realized my ambition and booked a room for us at the St Paul Rive Gauche. I had spent some time researching the various hotels listed in Trip Advisor, and this hotel was chosen because of the accommodation available â€“ a ground floor room with a spiral staircase leading to an upper room, the shower room being on the upper level. The shower room had everything one could need and was of a superior standard. It was spotlessly clean, as was the room, on both levels. I cannot speak too highly of our choice. We both found it absolutely excellent in every way. The accommodation was spacious and overlooking a very attractive patio, and the staff, both day and night staff, all extremely friendly and helpful with special thanks to Blandine, whose friendly attitude when booking, helped to clinch our choice. The flat screen TV and the small safe and mini-bar were very useful and we appreciated the use of the Internet. The room was very quiet at night, since the windows on both levels overlooked the internal patio, and not the street. The hotel cat, Skype, also was a great plus point. He needed little encouragement to spend a lot of time in our room, since it was on the ground floor and he was able to get in and out of the window into the patio, and is extremely playful. The location is very good â€“ we were able to walk to a lot of the places we wanted to see and also felt quite safe when coming back late at night. We were spoilt for choice regarding places to eat for lunch and dinner. We had the hotelâ€™s included breakfast, taken in the very attractive breakfast room, and it was very good and plentiful. We both loved it. I could enthuse a lot more, but will content myself by saying that this hotel cannot be faulted in any way. It is absolutely excellent, and I do hope I shall have the pleasure of staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeS45
Reviews.Content: Visited this Hotel twice,it's friendly, English spoken, very clean & attractive decor. The resident cat is Skype, who is so sweet , his predessesor Sputnick was the same RIP.The breakfast is continental, good selection of food, sets you up for the morning. The location is in the heart of the Latin quarter, plenty of interesting shops and very close to the elegant Blvd St Germain & the Luxemburg Gardens.....lovely for a relaxing stroll in the afternoon. Will certainly visit this Hotel on next visit to Paris, my friend from New Zealand certainly enjoyed her stay. Just to add, Notre Dame, Musee de Orsee,Isle de France etc.. all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Patisserieauphile
Reviews.Content: Great location-- friendly staff--- pristeen room and bathroom,-- cold air and easily accessed by trains from all points. Loved it and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “charming bijou hotel... can't wait to go back !”
Reviews.Author: frenchexpat067
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights and 3 days in Paris and enjoyed this lovely hotel. Rooms are nicely decorated, great bathrooms with italian showers, spotlessly clean. The personnel of the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. The hotel is in a great location at the heart of the Latin quarter on the left bank, within walking distance of a wide selection of restaurants, Notre Dame, Orsay Museum, Louvre....jazz clubs... no need to take taxis, you can walk to most places. . We recommend also the Bateaux Parisiens lunch (or evening) cruise which added a little magic to our week-end. We can't wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “small but nice”
Reviews.Author: mdzieg
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 teens. We stayed on the top floor with a nice view out of the window. clean and a good location. Try the Horse's Tavern nearby. Skip the breakfast and grab food at one of the very close cafes or brassieres. With in walking distance of the Metro. Luxembourg Gardens is also close and a nice area. the Horse head fountains from the movie "Gigi" are located in the park

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Want for Meeting Paris”
Reviews.Author: paxnrth
Reviews.Content: A few blocks from everything--Seine, Notra Dame, Sourbonne, Luxembourge Gardens, The Cluney, Musee de Orsey, Louvre. Classy low crime neighborhood, upscale from the crowded Left Bank. Greeted by the hotel cat every day. Good free breakfast included. Ancient Building with exposed rough beams, done up with 21st century bathrooms and beds. Flower box in the windows. Quiet at night. English friendly. Small but available elevator for moving your suitcases up. Once you get settled in, though you'll not really want to move out. Reasonable prices in an expensive city. Don't you dare tell Rick Steves about this one! Don't bring a car to Paris, Metro stop ODEON or RER rail LUXEMBOURG stop from the CDG airport puts you 2-3 blocks a way, and you can go everywhere on the METRO or RER.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and we'll for sure come back.”
Reviews.Author: Crazyforparis
Reviews.Content: Great left bank location yet on a nice quiet street. Near Odeon metro stop. Just steps from the Luxemberg garden. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff is wonderful. The room size we had for two single beds was adequate by American standards but very generous for Paris standards. The buffet breakfast is nice to have available. The food is fresh and plenty of it. There is also a resident cat who is simply charming.

Reviews.Title: “6 Amazing Nights here - Great Location - Quiet - Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: VTJedi
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel. We had the hardest time choosing a hotel in Paris. We wanted something close to the sights and in either the latin quarter of saint germaine area. Well this hotel sits just north east of Luxembourg Gardens and right in between both of those arrondisments (the 5th and 6th). I'm glad we picked it. To start off - the rates are reasonable. Paris is expensive and so was this hotel... but by booking early with the hotel we saved a LOT of money. They have great deals on their own website and I highly recommend booking through the hotel for better deals than you'll find on a third party booking site. The mini bar was nice - we stored our drinks and snacks in it. The internet worked well all except the morning we left when it got spotty. And we were on the 5th floor and that was pretty good for it to be so fast! There is also a hotel computer to use if you need it. We had a superior room and it was worth it for the extra space. It was on the 5th floor and faced the street. Amazingly quiet. The back of the hotel is a private school (a very famous school with graduates wining nobel prizes and some buried in the pantheon - also nearby). So it's a quiet place. The noisiest experience for us was the family occupying 2 rooms in the suite next to us who's children would run around slamming doors and knock on our door by mistake waking us up. I think they spent more time in the hotel than out enjoying Paris... but thankfully we only had to deal with their noise in the early evenings before we went out! No noise at night waking us up! The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is spacious. Very modern. Nice amenities. We loved how they have an "eco" card explaining guests may re-use towels to save on energy. We don't use new towels each day at home and we are conservationists as much as we can be... so I always love seeing those cards to remind people to save energy if they choose to by reusing their towels! If not - they will bring you fresh ones daily. There was a large wardrobe in the room big enough for suitcases and clothes. A small room safe which worked but not big enough for iPad or a laptop computer. The staff are very nice and will help with anything. We didn't feel like restaurant reservations were needed in Paris if you got to a place by 8PM. Do try nearby Le Petit Prince for dinner. It's amazingly delicious french food and reasonable costs. The metro is nearby as is the RER to CDG airport and RER to Versailles. We did not have the breakfast as we thought it was too expensive at 13 euro... but we found plenty of places and cafes all around Saint Michele area and even at the end of the hotel street near Saint Michele was a delightful Crepe place to get a breakfast crepe and coffee or croissant. Very cheap. This hotel was superb in every way and we could find no faults here. The nit-picky reviewers are a bit ridiculous sometimes and out of touch. It's hard to find a major fault here. A great hotel - a lot of Americans staying here though! And a friendly baby kitten they just got named skype who loves to play!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: EdwardMarie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the end of May was very enjoyable. We paid more for a larger room and it was worth it. Our bathroom was large, we had a sofa, table, chairs and standing bureau. We peeked in the other rooms and are very glad that we paid for the larger room, if you can do it, I would highly recommend it. We used the internet which was spotty at times, but overall worked fine. The hotel was clean, staff very polite and quite. The breakfast was fairly decent (hard boiled eggs, pastries, yogurt, meats). The fruit was cut up in a bowl and would have preferred whole fruit or not in a bowl of juice. I got a banana from the little market next door and brought that with me to breakfast. We were happy to have breakfast available instead of having to find a place (although it would have probably been easy). The hotel is close to the train (we took the train from the airport) and is within walking distance to many sites (Notre Dame is about 15 minutes away). If you are a runner, this is the place to go. The Luxumbourg Park is 5 minutes away and the loop inside is about a mile and a quarter. It was perfect, beautiful and a wonderful way to start the day. We went every morning. There are a few places to eat on the street but many of them are Japanese run by Chinese (not overly authentic), there are places along the main street which is not far away. We got some sandwiches and salad and went to Luxembourg Park for a picnic - highly recommended. We bought a Paris pass that pays for itself quickly if you plan to high the highlights (Louvre, Versailles, St. Chapel, etc). It was my first time to Paris and I was not quite ready for the crowds. Overall a good trip and a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: bobbocalif
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights at this wonderful hotel. It was so charming, very comfortable room, great quiet location. What made this place so great was the staff. They were all so kind, helpful, answered all our questions, helped us with metro advise, etc. They made us feel right at home. Breakfast was a perfect way to start the day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: idish
Reviews.Content: Really good pints: - Great location. - Friendly, helpful staff. - Nice classy lobby decor. - Quiet. - Clean. Just ok: - bed ( a little too ridden but not too bad), - shower, - room size (but that's Paris). The downside: expensive (but I guess that's due to the location).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: edinsf
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel for 8 nights in early May 2011. This was my 8th visit to Paris in 21 years and this was unquestionably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. I had read many excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and they all proved to be quite accurate. I knew enough about the neighborhood that I definitely wanted to stay close to the Luxembourg Gardens. Besides the area being so pleasant and attractive, it is an easy location to get to from de Gaulle airport via the RER, thus avoiding the high cost of a taxi. The location is superb - close to so much of what one comes to see and do in Paris and yet the hotel is on a reasonably quiet, narrow one-way street. I had requested a specific room that I saw on the hotel's website and the room was ready for us when we arrived, even though we arrived 2 hours before the posted 3 PM check-in time. Even though the room faced the street, the double pane windows did an excellent job blocking any street noise. The room was attractive, small by American standards, but quite comfortable and promptly refreshed each morning. The bathroom was surprisingly large and had been gorgeously updated. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well each evening. We had breakfast every morning in the charming dining area in the lower level - the reservation we made included breakfast. Besides the excellent traditional French items - (coffee, croissants, pain au chocolat, French bread) there was fresh juice, cheese, meats, fruit salad, and cereal. Our service was excellent and we were given an extra pot of coffee each time we requested it, which was a real treat for 2 serious coffee drinkers. I know we would have spent significantly more for a less filling meal elsewhere. The hotel staff were extremely professional, friendly and very helpful. They also all spoke excellent English. While I studied French in both high school and college and do my best to speak the language, my spoken French is fairly limited. I was in France after all so I strongly believed I had an obligation to at least try to communicate in the native language. A pet peeve of mine is the rude expectation of so many Americans that everyone else should speak English - such an arrogant & obnoxious attitude!!! Free Wi-Fi was also a nice feature, although it was a bit slow. There also is a computer in the lobby which can be used at no charge. And the laundromat directly across the street from the hotel was a nice bonus as well. I could write further about my wonderful experience at this delightful hotel but there are many others who echo my sentiments. Should I have the pleasure of going back to my favorite place in the world, I would definitely plan at staying at the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche once again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: PGreen
Reviews.Content: Good location as a base for site seeing. Walking distance to most major attractions, many nearby restaurants, Luxemborg Park and netro. Small hotel with nice breakfast, reee internet and pleasant staff. The room was of adequate size with jacuzzi and stall shower. Very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A great two nights stay”
Reviews.Author: deborah07040
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche after striking out on other less expensive hotels on the right bank, where I really wanted to stay. Our two nights' stay there was over our budget but it could very well have been worth it. Our room was the largest we have ever had in Paris, it was quiet, and it was cute. We were on the ground floor, with the only window looking out on their minuscule garden. We had a fabulous jacuzzi bathtub and very whimsical "starry night" lights over the bed. The bed was large and very comfortable, and the room was tastefully decorated. Staff was friendly but a bit too eager to speak English when it was obvious I understood and spoke French. The hotel is on a nice quiet street. For some reason there is a concentration of Japanese restaurants on the street, which were packed full by 7 PM with Asian people. So if you want to eat Japanese food in Paris, rue Monsieur le Prince is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but unbelievable small bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant stay. Female staff were helpful and courteous. Male staff sullen and moody. Frenchmen I guess. Bedroom was well presented and a good size. The bathroom is a disaster. I expected small bathrooms in Paris. But this one is the smallest out of the hotels I stayed in while I spent two weeks tripping around France. Breakfasts were also ordinary and the worst of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxiestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche in early April. I had emailed hotel staff several times before our arrival with specific questions about different rooms. The staff were helpful and responsive. We loved the hotel. It has a great location, right in the middle of Paris, but on a relatively quiet street. The front desk staff were really delightful and spoke excellent English, so communication was easy. Our room was small, but we expected that. The double glazed windows worked really well and shut out the street noise. We didn't hear much from other hotel guests, except when they were talking in the hall. The bathroom was small, but very efficient, and we loved the shower. We didn't eat at the hotel, so we can't comment on the breakfast. Skype, the hotel's cat, is a wonderful addition and very sweet. We will definitely try and stay at the hotel for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: UlfB
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we tried in Paris. Helpful staff, nice room, excellent location in the city. Very good breakfast. Perhaps a bit expensive, but that's Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Keeps me coming back for more”
Reviews.Author: intlwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at St. Paul hotel at least five times now. It's ideally located for those who come over on the Eurostar or who come from CDG. It's on the RER B Luxembourg Station. It's quiet, quaint and the staff are lovely. I became attached to Sputnik, the cat with a major personality. When I stayed this March I was sad to hear Sputnik had passed away (at 18) but he had a new successor - Skype. Very cute and fiesty. The rooms are clean, comfortable and they've redone much if not all of them over the years, so the bathrooms have the latest amenities. The walls can be on the thin side and I have been able to hear other guests, but the pros outweigh the cons for me. Is it the nicest place in Paris? Definitely not. But it consistently delivers on friendly, reliable service with clean, comfortable rooms. I know what I'm going to get, and I look forward to my stay every time I return. I have recommended this place already to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a second!”
Reviews.Author: KBHR1
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. I have always loved this neighborhood, and our stay this time only confirmed that. Walk up the block and you're in Luxembourg Gardens. Down the hill is Odeon Carrefour and easy access to the metro and buses (The RER, train from CDG is an easy walk from the Luxembourg stop). There are wonderful restaurants, cafes and bistros within an easy walk. The Seine is a slow 15 minute walk. The hotel staff couldn't have been more accommodating or helpful. The rooms we stayed in were comfortable and quite clean, though a little small - but still larger than many I've stayed in in Europe. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel myself, but I'm told it was good. (The best croissant in the city can be found around the corner at Cafe Viennois, and Cafe Les Editeurs and Cafe Danton, are just down the hill). Great cat lives in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Umf
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel with friendly staff!! Would definitely recommend this to anyone. Loved the original features in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Valesch
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in the internet after a long searching. I had been oft in Paris and never found the right hotel, which would be not too expensive but yet a nice place to stay, clean, romantic and with a normal size room. And here we are: this hotel was perfect; the personnel was very kind; we had a good breakfast in the morning and could leave our luggage at the hotel also after our ckeckout. I do absolutely suggest this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: mooseachusetts
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this hotel isn't mentioned in Paris guide books. It's conveniently located, the staff is friendly and accommodating. Our family sized room was very economical for two adults and two tweens; extremely spacious by Parisian standards. Bath was nicely remodeled recently. Best of all, there is a feline resident named Skype, a darling black and white kitten.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: herba317
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Paul for four nights in August and would highly recommend it for the price paid. The room was very small (as expected) but it was extremely clean and the employees were very helpful. The locations was perfect--5 minutes from Notre Dame with several subway stops nearby. The addresses on the street weren't sequential, and 43, rue Monsieur le Prince was directly across from #24.

Reviews.Title: “St Germain Gem”
Reviews.Author: tigercubbie_10
Reviews.Content: We had 5 great nights here at tthe end of October, 2010. The hotel is very clean and has a quaint Parisian charm. The hotel staff was very helpul and friendly and answered all of our questions. The location is very convenient to many museumes, cafes and shops. We walked to Notre Dame which was an easy 15 to 20 minute walk. The Cluny Museum and Luxembourg Gardens are both a few blocks away. It was great to start each morning in the unique basement breakfast room which is entered by a winding staircase in the hotel lobby. We chose this hotel based on the many positve TA reviews and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic find....excellent!”
Reviews.Author: elverahodgy
Reviews.Content: We loved this fantastic hotel. The room was gorgeous, it was spotless with a brilliant bathroom and excellent shower. We were upgraded from a standard room so obviously that was much appreciated. We had free wifi in the bedroom too. The staff were so friendly and willing to help with any questions. I actually shouldn't tell you all about it because it will just become more popular and then we might not get a room when we return to Paris! Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “One Word: Charming”
Reviews.Author: AnnaColagro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming and wonderful. We stayed in a beutiful room, that was peaceful and had a fanstastic shower. Skype (the beautiful kitten) is an attraction. But no worries if you are not a cat person, you won't be bothered. The location is fantastic, on a lovely street full os restaurants, cafes, and a Monoprix on the corner. The only 'warning' I give is that if you absolutely need a hair dryer, bring your own. The one in our room was not potent enough. Ps. Wifi is free and works very well!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -great value”
Reviews.Author: shoppermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 9 days in Paris during the Christmas season. This was the perfect hotel for us - close to great restaurants, metro stops, major sites, and shopping and a great value for the money. Since we had an extended stay, our rate included breakfast which was more than enough to get us started for the day. The best part of the hotel was the wonderful staff. Always smiling and willing to assist with any needs. They made us dinner reservations most nights and were so friendly and pleasant to talk to. They all spoke great English and even the breakfast staff was polite and ready with our pot of coffee each morning. If you are looking for a quaint small hotel in the heart of Paris, this would be a great choice. The rooms are a bit small but worked for us - we did book a superior room so had a little more space. We had a modern bathroom and very comfortable bed linens. Our room did face the street and was a bit noisy in the early AMs but who wants to sleep late in Paris when there is so much to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: tikkadog
Reviews.Content: This past stay was my third stay at the hotel. The hotel's location is perfect. Located in the 6th district the hotel has access to multiple metro stops and the RER line. The hotel is within walking district to numerous restaurants, patisseries and shops. The rooms are small-yet adequate. The bathrooms have recently been renovated. The hotel has complimentary internet in the lobby. The hotel staff are friendly and speak English. My breakfast was included in the room price. Breakfast is 13 euros-which seems to be standard for Paris. The breakfast includes croissants, pain de chocolate, boiled eggs, yogurt, muesli and cereal, fruit cocktail and prunes There are also cold meats which were disappointing-looked like bologne and plastic wrapped cheese. It would be nice if the hotel had coffee and tea facilities in the lobby for when the breakfast hour is over. There is a small fridge in the room that is stocked with wine and other drinks. Should you need a laundromat there is one directly across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth stay at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jholiday27
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Hotel Saint-Paul and it was as we remembered. Great location, wonderful helpful staff, clean and bright room.. We opted for a large superior double room which had ample closet and storage space and felt roomy. Many nice restaurants,shopping and sights in walking distance and very close to the Metro. Breakfast served in our room was a real treat. When we return to Paris we will return to Hotel Saint-Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, clean, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ecg24
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I traveled to Paris for 6 days in Sept. I firmly believe that one of the main reasons our trip was so fabulous was because of the location and quality of this hotel! Ok, its not a 5 star, its not like over the top, with huge rooms and bathrooms. But it is absolutely perfect for what we wanted. We were not in the room during the day as we were out sightseeing non stop. But every day around 5pm we would return to our hotel, change, and head out to the cafes and restaurants in the Latin Qtr/Left Bank - all in walking distance of this hotel. We didn't hang out in any other part of town because THIS PART of town has it all! Odeon metro is super close to the hotel. The area doesn't have a touristy feel, its all locals, every restaurant and cafe packed every night! This is just a great part of town. There are also local attractions really close that are not to be missed: St Sulpice (great shopping over there too), Pantheon, Sorbonne area, and Luxembourg Gardens. The Gardens were BEYOND gorgeous and one day when we were tired of sightseeing we got a bottle of wine and sat in Luxembourg Gardens people watching. It was the best day! There is also a great little bar near the hotel called La Pinte. Its great! The cafe life is fabulous along rue St Germain! Les Editors is fun, we also ate at Marco Polo which was tasty italian. As for the hotel itself, the room was very clean. The internet access was a bit slow but always worked. I know people complained about it but we didn't have a problem as we were only checking email and news. The bathroom was small, and the floor got soaked when you took a shower but that is standard for european hotels! The bed was comfy and every night was quiet. The other hotel guests appeared to be middle age couples. Everyone was exhausted from the day I'm sure! I got the breakfast included cause I need my coffee. The breakfast was in the basement and was basically coffee/tea, croisants, bread, yogurt, etc. Just enough to get you going. I really appreciated that! You can also walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Rodin, and even the Eiffel Tour if the weather is nice. My one word of advice is to get a laminated hand held map of Paris it saved us when we were walking around! This hotel was absolutely perfect and made our trip all the better. Paris is amazing! I can't wait to go back and I would definitely stay here again! Its all about location!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel. Small, friendly, beautifully presented and well located”
Reviews.Author: green_annabel
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. All the staff were friendly and accomodating and the rooms are stylish and beautifully presented. The location is just on the edge of the tourist centre so, although the sights are within walking distance, the local restaurants and cafes have a more Parisien feel to them. We will be staying here again next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay here - could not be happier”
Reviews.Author: parisisthebest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel three times over the past 4 years. We will never opt for another hotel. It is the perfect mix of helpful staff, cleanliness, location and price! The staff has ALWAYS been wonderful and helpful - they make and confirm restaurant reservations for us, give suggestions on what to do and always do it with a smile. The rooms are small, of course, but very comfortable and not unusable by any means. Who stays in their room a lot when they are in Paris anyway??? The location is perfect as well. We have recommended this hotel to several people and have always gotten good reviews from them as well.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious”
Reviews.Author: irenic1951
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean and quiet, well except for the noisy children that were up early and screaming in the hall. The staff was excellent, they were available to us every time we had questions. All the staff was magnificent. Breakfast was wonderful, cafe was ready around 6:00AM, we had it in our room, they woulf fix us a tray and we would take it to our room then come down for breakfast. There is a wonderful restaurant on the left side of the street after going left when you exit the hotel. A gorgeous boutique on the street down, we were close to the metro stop, they arranged for a van to transport us to the train station, it was a glorious time at the Hotel St. Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very Parisian”
Reviews.Author: Twopees
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a four night visit at the quaint Hotel St Paul. Welcoming and helpful English speaking reception staff who are able to book tours, also has free fast internet located in the ground floor foyer and a lovely little sitting room. Breakfast downstairs in the cellar with a good selection of cold foods and cereals. Located just around the corner from Boulevard St Michel and about a 10 minute walk to the River Seine, Notre Dame and 20 minutes to the Louvre. Lots of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby and a handy little shop up the road for drinks, fruit, food etc. A laundromat is located across the road. We took the advice of another Trip Advisor contributor and book a superior room, good advice. Room 44 on level 4 is just lovely. Paris is a wonderful city and lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel in ideal location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl035
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at Hotel St. Paul Rive Gauche. The bed linens were very comfortable, the room small and traditionally quaint with giant, lace-covered windows to throw open for air, exposed beams, and a modern bathroom. There is a very nice breakfast in the quaint whitewashed curved-ceilinged brick cafe in the lower regions of the hotel run by exemplary kitchen staff. A comfortable sitting room and the computer station round out the conveniences presented. The maids are as charming and polite as can be and the front counter staff could not be a finer, more helpful group of people if you hand-picked them yourself. They assisted us with several unusual circumstances and requests, going above and beyond what you would expect to experience at a hotel...and all with a smile. I would name names but I do not want to leave a single one of them out! The location is fabulous...restaurants, bars, clothing shopping, bookstores, and street cafes are all within a few steps to five short blocks away. Historic landmarks such as the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Pantheon, the Sorbonne, Le Jardin de Luxembourg, and the Seine and Louvre are all within easy walking distance. Monoprix is about a block away for chips, almond-stuffed olives, pistachios, and bordeaux for those lovely late afternoon breaks in the room before heading out to dinner. The Metro is 3 to 5 minutes away, depending on which station you head for. And finally, there is Monsieur Sputnik, the 16 year old cat who, like his name, makes sure he orbits from person to person to give them that homey feeling only provided by a cat with an attitude. We were all concerned when he came home from the vet with a blue bandage wrapped tightly around his skinny paw and he gladly accepted our cooing and lamenting words. I spent my last minutes in Paris with his front legs looped across my knees and found it very difficult to part from him. Thank you, Hotel St. Paul Rive Gauche!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ParisaBarry
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris last night after staying there for 8 nights. It was my fourth trip but first for my husband. He was very excited about this because it was kind of our wedding anniversary too, PARIS :) I originally booked the hotel for 3 nights because we were not sure if we want to stay the whole time in Paris, we were thinking about visiting London too. I did get the room from their website as the last minute deal, so price was reasonable but for us, WIFI was a big deal. We wanted a room with internet access because we wanted to plan everything for our following day; also my husband had to check his emails frequently because of his business. Hotel advertises WIFI but don't believe that. I read in one of the reviews the WIFI doesn't work but after that the manager replied that it was just a temporary problem. Every time we told them about internet they came up with: 1- Oh, sorry, it is because you are using IPAD? Dauh? Why should that be different from a laptop? 2-Sorry, it just happened today, I am going to call the internet provider right now (and she starts looking at some number to show you she really wants to call!) 3- Oh, we never had this problem before, I guess this is the whole neighborhood; we all have this problem today!! Câ€™mon, we are coming from North America, we know what is internet! Just tell us it is not working and end all these games instead of wasting our time by trying 3 different user name/ pass words or shutting down at 2 AM in the morning! And finally the guy in reception told me their internet provider is a cheap one and some of the rooms don't have any internet access, end of the story! I upgraded our room on the fourth night to a bigger room just to try the internet and told the lady at the front desk, I am not sure how many days I want to stay. She said, No problem, I will put a note in your file which states customer can stay till further notice and I happily signed that. She was in heaven when I upgraded my room since I was paying more and her rooms were empty (Tuesday night). Room was in 4th floor, but as expected the elevator was not working but internet was working!! On Thursday morning, when we dropped our key, the other receptionist told us, you have to leave today because your room is booked! Imagine, you are in vacation and leaving to enjoy your day and they just decide to ask you to leave because it is Thursday and they could rent their room! She was very rude and we were shocked by her attitude. Then after she said, I can put you in another room but for sure your room is booked for Friday and Saturday because we didnâ€™t reserve the room for you! They filled their empty room with us and as soon as their room was booked probably with higher rates, they told us to leave and even didnâ€™t have the courtesy to give us a call a day before and ask us if we want to stay or not! I didnâ€™t want to stay one more min there, therefore I started to search for hotels and you know how frustrating that is while you are on vacation but thank God, that is Paris and it is full of hotels! On our way out, she told me she is sorry ( don't know for what though) while my poor husband was carrying our suitcases from the 4th floor because as usual the elevator was broken, the elevator she told me in the morning will work if I wait 2 min! I found the Best Western 5 min from this hotel and got a beautiful room, double sided window, fast internet with elevator working all the time + break fast, free non alcoholic drinks, welcome champagne and cheese, salad and bread every afternoon just for 10 Euro more, so if you are looking for challenge, go to this hotel but if you want a relaxing vacation with some customer service, this is not a place for you. I hope the manager of this hotel doesnâ€™t reply me. He/she has a tendency to come up with some excuses and convince people all these were temporary problems! Be honest and donâ€™t advertise things your hotel doesnâ€™t have.

Reviews.Title: “This is a quiet small hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: kkhill87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found it to be convenient to the metro and bus stops. It appeared to be in a very safe neighborhood and was clean with nice linens. The staff was small but helpful. The breakfast was good as was the coffee. It was easy to use their house computers.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its most charming!”
Reviews.Author: BethS14221
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's 2nd visit to Paris, but my first. We arrived very late in the evening, and I was cranky and exhausted from traveling. My first impression was not very nice -- I couldn't believe that 2 adults and 2 rolling suitcases were too big for the lift! However, I slept extremely well (very comfortable bed and linens) and in the morning was able to appreciate how spotlessly clean our room was. As our stay progressed, I came to fall in love with the Hotel St. Paul Rive Gauche. The room (a superior, I believe, facing the street) was small by American standards, but, hey, we were in Paris! The bathroom was beautifully clean and modern. The maid service was excellent. Most impressive of all, however, was the warm and personal attention from the front desk. They pleasantly answered all of our questions, offered directions to metro and bus stops, and made excellent restaurant recommendations. Of course, Sputnik provided another measure of charm and personality -- how many hotels anywhere have a resident cat? Thanks also for the free internet in the hotel lobby -- that was extremely useful. All in all, a wonderful, wonderful stay -- I hope I can someday return to Paris. I would definitely return to the Hotel St. Paul Rive Gauche!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and welcoming - high standard - great location”
Reviews.Author: Huw-and-Sue
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche on three occasion and have enjoyed a warm welcome each time. We have become accustomed to their customary helpfulness and the high standard of accommodation at this three star hotel; very comfortable and cosy. Our rooms have always have been spacious enough for our needs, the air conditioning is very effective, the standard of decor is very good and always clean and well presented. A mini bar and safe are also provided. Â  On this visit we discovered two things worth sharing with other guests Firstly, never visit Versailles on a Sunday in July unless you like crowds and also don't try to see everything in one visit. Book ahead by internet and save yourself a long wait in the ticket queue at Versailles. Hotel Saint Paul has broadband and internet connection and you can print the tickets before you go. Secondly, my wife and I discovered the simple and inexpensive pleasure of taking a picnic down to the bank of the Seine on a warm summer evening and just chilling out in the company of other Parisians all doing the same thing, listening to buskers and the babble of conversations well into the early hours - so civilized A word of warning though, on our first jaunt to the river we took a bottle of champagne to celebrate in style however I wouldnâ€™t recommend it as the 15 minute walk from the hotel is enough to turn your bottle of champagne into a lethal weapon. When we popped the cork we nearly killed two students and worse than that, we lost half the bubbly over the quay. So make it wine and donâ€™t forget a corkscrew, the French arenâ€™t big on screw tops. Â  Finally, the hotelâ€™s location on the Left Bank is very convenient; just 20 to 30 minutes by Metro from Gare Du Nor (line 4 to Odeon then a short walk). 15 minutes to the Luxembourg Gardens or Notre Dame it enjoys being pretty near to everything and still away from too much bustle. I thought it was also very nice of Hotel Saint Paul to ask Woody Allen to film in Rue Monsieur le Prince during our vacation; it was quite good fun to watch Woody Allen, Owen Wilson and Marion Cotillard working on their next film - Midnight in Paris. The location was the Polidor, a typical traditional style French restaurant just a few yards from the hotel. Weâ€™ve eaten there on a previous occasion and I can recommend it. Equally try Au Pere Lois, an equally authentic wine bar and restaurant just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. It's obvious to me that Hotel St Paul works very hard to make its guests feel welcomed which is whyÂ I cannot think of anywhere else we would prefer to stay and we are recommending this hotel to our friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saint Paul and Travelling = Perfect Partners”
Reviews.Author: grant010
Reviews.Content: I travelled from Melbourne Australia to Paris with my 13 year old grand-daughter and the perspective and vigour gained has been invaluable On arrival at Hotel Saint Paul we were welcomed by organised, calm and 'generous with time' reception staff Our room was truy delightful and suited our needs perfectly The information imparted from staff on the area, transport and restaurants was invaluable Breakfast is a wonderful experience in a room that is steeped in history and with staff and food that gets the day going perfectly The internet connection was fast and accessible and Sputnik the beautiful cat added to the charm of the Hotel Well done to all involved We look forward to seeing you again in 2011, hopefully xx

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - rude staff and tiny room”
Reviews.Author: csontravel
Reviews.Content: We have staying in Paris many times. We understand that Parisian hotel rooms are small and that Parisians can seem less than warm. Nonetheless we were very disappointed with this hotel. You can do much better in the neighbourhood. We booked it because they had a "family" room available, advertised as sleeping four. Unlike all the other rooms in the hotel it was not on sale and could only be booked at full price. However family rooms are sufficiently rare in Paris that we booked it anyway. It was a tiny space under the roof with a double bed and a single bed, with a trundle bed under the single bed. Unfortunately there was no room to actually pull out the trundle bed and also walk between the beds. However, when in Europe.... My real complaint was the rudness of the staff. Our room was supplied with only three pillows - none for the trundle bed. When we asked for a forth the response was "I am not certain we have any". They did eventually find one. We left the room early in the morning and returned about 3 p.m. It was not made up. The maid let herself into the room about 3:10 without knocking. I told her we were going out again in 20 minutes. She said no, that she had to clean it now because she was at the end of her shift and walked in and proceeded, with much angry huffing, to clean the room. We just sat there with our mouths open. When we went to check out I found we had been charged for the optional breakfasts we had not taken. When I pointed this out they, not very graciously, as if it was my fault, removed it from the bill. Certainly no apology. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “convenient well-run hotel in the 6th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: PhillyDoc
Reviews.Content: Our family including two teenagers stayed at the hotel last week during our family vacation in France. I had reserved based on tripadvisor reviews. The rooms were small and although they faced the street, they were very quiet with the windows closed-which was do-able since the hotel has air conditioning. The bathrooms were modern and the shower was excellent. This was a great relief, since we were staying there on the Fete du Musique holiday which consists of loud music in the streets to the wee hours of the morning. The daily breakfast buffet was included in the rate which was appreciated by our family given the appetites of my teenaged children. The buffet included pastries, baguettes, yogurt, cheese, fruit salad and sliced meat. The breakfast room is in the basement and quite small but we enjoyed having the convenience of having the breakfast at the hotel. The location of the hotel was outstanding, near at least 3 Metro stations and within walking distance of several very good restaurants and many of the local sights including the Louvre. the hotel staff were gracious, helpful and professional. Although free wi-fi internet was available in the rooms, the signal was very slow. There is also a computer in the lobby, I was not able to send any document attachments because of the slow internet speed so this is not a good choice for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The location is convenient but quiet and the staff is very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: wj195
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a tad small, one doesn't travel overseas to stay in a room. They were cozy and well designed with very comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. The location in the Latin Quarter is full of well priced shops and cafes and there are several convenient Metro stops nearby. All the staff was friendly and helpful, speaking English but listening patiently as we butchered French. The hotel cat Sputnick was a charming addition to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “100% romantic!”
Reviews.Author: thecommunitygirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was PERFECT! Hotel Saint Paul is extremely cute - like a dolls house. The staff were so pleasant and accommodating. We were upgraded to a suite and whilst I suspect most rooms in this hotel would be small (like all hotel rooms in Paris), our room was very spacious. We were immediately impressed by how clean the room was, crisp white linen and VERY comfortable bed. The decor was colorful yet simple. And most important - double glazed windows which guaranteed a quiet night sleep. If you stay here - we'd highly recommend a restaurant close by, which was suggested by the hotel, Bouillon Racine.

Reviews.Title: “Character full hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AmandaN052
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in May 2010. We were pleased to find such an attractive hotel, and our double room with ensuite bath/shower was very nice. We were really pleased with choice of hotel, the only downside was the room rate which we both thought was pretty expensive. I would recommend to others for a good nights sleep in a boutique style hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in in Paris - by far!”
Reviews.Author: NetteFenner
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our short honeymoon on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room (we did go for the superior) spotlessly clean and spacious. Breakfast was great and was available until 11am so we didn't have to rush down there every morning. The hotel itself was on a quiet street but only 5 minutes walk away from the Musee de Cluny (highly recommended) and the shops of St Germain and St Michel. St Severin is close by for small shops and bistros and is lovely in the evenings. Just a few minutes walk away is Jardin de Luxembourg which is perfect for a lazy afternoon or a picnic. Sputnik the cat is worth the tariff all on his own - a real character! Next time I go to Paris, I will make every effort to stay in this lovely little hotel. A perfect honeymoon - thank you Hotel St-Paul

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EssexBandol
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Saint Paul. What a great time we had. Hotel very comfortable, staff were very very helpful. We stayed in a standard room which was quite small, but very clean and quiet. The breakfast suited our needs and finished at 11 o'clock so we didn't have to rush, and we were often visited by Sputnik, the resident cat. The surrounding area was full of great bars and very french restaurants. Wonderful location for all the sightseeing tours. Lots of walking was done, where we were constantly looking up at all the wonderful architecture. We also did the 'hop on hop off' buss tour which is a must and also the Moulon Rouge, the River Trip and of course the Eiffel Tower. It has been 10 years since we last visited Paris, but we will certainly not leave it as long next time. Jan & Dave

Reviews.Title: “Cautious review”
Reviews.Author: jimnich
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris so we actually have nothing to compare it with but hopefully we have a few tips to help others. Firstly, we had a superb time and would go back to this nice, friendly, well situated hotel. The staff were lovely, the cat a charmer and the room was spotlessy clean although it did need a lick of paint here and there. We paid for a Classic room (26) which was basic but with a superb newly refurbushed bathroom. It was stuck right at the back of the hotel and looked out onto grimey brick walls, roofs and noisy air conditioning ducts. The first nights sleep was non-existant as there was a loud monotone buzz which we spent most of the night trying to find but to no avail. Next morning, on leaving the room, when we took the electricity card out of the socket the buzzing stopped so problem sorted but it did make us tired all that day. Was it worth the money? Well, Paris is an expensive city and we really don't have the experience to say one way or the other but all things being equal we are happy with our choice and are still happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: parisienne1840
Reviews.Content: hotel st-paul was the perfect place to stay for a week in paris. it was marvelously located near the luxembourg gardens so everything we wanted to see in the older part of paris was within walking distance and if we wanted to go further afield, we were a block from the bus, metro & rer stations. the rooms were extremely comfortable,quiet & impeccably clean; the breakfast bountiful. but best of all, the staff was delightful and always cheerful & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, romantic hotel in charming neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MrMarkini
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in a perfect location for Left Bank strolling - just a block from the Jardin du Luxembourg in one direction, and the Blvd. St. Germain (two blocks) in the other. We chose a 'superior' double room, and it was perfect - stunning, newly renovated bath, comfy bed, two windows out onto the street. The staff were charming, warm and friendly, and had great restaurant and transportation recommendations. (A plus of this location is it makes it easy to take the RER from DeGaulle - a 9 euro, 30 min train ride lets you off a short block from the hotel.) At the Carrefour d'Odeon are several sweet restaurants and cafes; we enjoyed them all. Our room (44) was on the '4th' (ie, 5th) floor - a typical small French elevator takes you there; when we opened a window, street sounds were promient - the (new) windows, when closed, sealed it out completely. We slept very very well. We loved being so close to so many lovely places - a pleasant stroll to the Seine, a few paces from the Luxembourg gardens, and part of the maze of ancient streets around the Odeon and the Sorbonne. The Odeon and Maubert Metro stops were close by as well - to take the Metro to many places requires, generally, just one change, which is nice.
