Note to prospective guests - study the options on their booking website carefully, as they have several different types of packages - we chose 'stay 3 nights, and get a 4th free' - making the rate very affordable -- even paying for a slightly larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet”
Reviews.Author: wtraveler
Reviews.Content: I lived in Paris in the 90's so I knew exactly where I wanted to stay. This hotel is at a perfect location, a walking distance from the Pantheon, jardin de Luxembourg, Odeon, La sorbonne, St Michel, Notre Dame, the Seine, le louvre, Quai d'Orsay... Bottomline, you are in the center of Paris. My room was a little small but had everything. It is not your typical american hotel but a Parisian hotel in an old building with Poutre in the ceiling. This is the oldest wood in the world and is very precious. So I was surprised to read one of the reviews mentioning this as a disadvantage. There are more modern rooms in the hotel. You just have to ask. The ladies at the front desk are amazing and speak english, french,italian and german. I think I asked 100 questions the first day and there was always a smile. I did not have breakfast at the hotel but had a croissant and coffee on St germain. Last day, I ordered breakfast in my room and I was pleasntly surprised: A french baguette, croissants, yogurt, cheese, jam and coffee. The bigger surprise was I did not have to pay for it as a nice gesture from the hotel staff. The hotel is near the very famous restaurant: Le comptoir d'Odeon. make sure to make reservation as soon as you decide on visiting Paris. I took a museum pass for 3 days, open tour for 2 days and Paris visite for 3 days that allow you unlimited public transportaion for 6 zones including Versailles. Open tour allows you to hop on and off at all attractions. There are 4 circuits. As for the museum pass it is totally worth it but museums are closed either Monday or Tuesday so plan your stay accordingly. Enjoy the food, the happiness and life in Paris and definitely stay in this charming hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly, helpful staff. Brilliant breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkAuntieJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter which is a good central location within easy walking distance of Notre Dame and well served by public transport. There were some cheaper restaurants nearby (rue de la harpe) with set meals as low as 10 euros (though you probably get what you pay for). Our rooms were at the back of the building overlooking the university. Though the rooms were not large, we had everything we needed and were very comfortable. We kept up to date with the winter olympics on the excellent flat screen telly. Everything worked and was spotlessly clean and the decor throughout the hotel has been done very tastefully. Our buffet breakfast was just right (although I wasn't sure if we were allowed to ask for more coffee). Every morning there was fresh fruit salad, prunes, muesli, cornflakes, different sorts of bread, pains aux raisins, pains aux chocolats, croissants and various cold meats, cheese, jams, spreads and honey. Sputnik the cat is quite a personality and very reluctant to budge from the best seat in the guests' sitting area near reception (there's also free internet access and the daily papers.) The hotel was very happy to look after our bags after we'd checked out and we found them to be extremely courteous and helpful. They spoke great English but they were patient with us when we tried out our rusty French on them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and not bad value (it's Paris, after all!)”
Reviews.Author: cathalr_99
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a whistlestop couple of days in Paris with my wife. We were "upgraded" to a room on the top floor, which when we saw it made us wonder what the standard room was like (for size), but other than the size of the rooms, there could be no complaint about this hotel. This is NOT luxury, but it is a fine hotel, in a great location, with helpful staff and an ok breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, cozy athmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Arielf44
Reviews.Content: the stay at the Saint Paul Hotel was marvelous. the room was spacious and comfortable and was kept very clean every day. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the location itself is great - a few minutes walk from any main attraction in the Left Bank, while still in a very quite street. we highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bayleaf_10
Reviews.Content: A really lovely little hotel in a great location. Only 5 mins or so walk from the Notre Dame & Jardin de Luxembourg & in a very good area with lots of little restaurants & bars. The staff were exceptionally friendly & helpful. Our room, whilst small, was spotlessly clean with a very comfy bed (and to be honest for central Paris & the price we weren't expecting a huge room). The Polidor restaurant next door is worth a visit (very rustic, typically french food) as are some of the restaurants in the Rue des Canettes area (Saint-Germaine) - only 5 mins walk away. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: JohnandShauna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Saint-Paul during the first week of January 2010. While Paris froze outside with the Arctic winds and first sprinkling of snow, we were warm and cozy inside this hotel. Our room was comfortable and very clean, while the guest sitting room with fireplace near reception on the ground floor provided a lovely place to sit and look at the world go by through the large picture window overlooking the street. Sputnik le chat welcomed us from the reception counter each day as we came and went. The staff were exceptional, helping us to organise our travel plans, especially when there were delays with flights out of Paris due to the heavy snow across Europe. Merci beaucoup. A bientot.

Reviews.Title: “Warm cosy stay”
Reviews.Author: llennard
Reviews.Content: Hotel St Paul or should be re nameD Hotel Sputnik as that cat really owns this quaint hotel!!!. It is located in easy walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame, Metro, Jardin Luxembourg, Louvre the Big Tour Bus and some great restaurants. The staff could not have been more helpful nothing was an issue. Rooms are cosy quaint clean. Breakfast in the old cellar is adequate and the baguette is YUMMY.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, but no frills and tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jazzyc43
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel couldn't have been more helpful. The room was absolutely minute, the shower room was furnished from a dolls house, no plug in basin. There was nowhere to sit and put on makeup. The breakfast was adequate, nothing hot. No bar or anywhere to get a drink n the evening. However, very near to several nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Olafolie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saint-Paul was super nice! The staff were very nice and helpful. The entire hotel was spotless. Our room and bathroom were spacious and very nicely decorated- we had a beautiful and comfortable 4-post bed, flat screen TV, etc. Could not hear a sound from other rooms, even though the hotel was completely full. Huge windows and high ceilings. The location could not be better (in the border between the 5th and 6th district-Latin Quarter & Saint Germain), close to several metro stations, RER station, tons of restaurants, and walking distance to the Louvre, the Cafe de Flore, and the Luxembourg gardens. Breakfast was a generous array of pastries, bread, deli meats, cheese, fruit- very nice. Sputnik the cat was very cute! I loved everything about this hotel, and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great service and good value.”
Reviews.Author: tagalongP
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms in Europe in small as a general rule. Most hotels were not originally built as hotels, they have been converted from existing buildings many of which are 200+ years old. Obviously they try to create a many rooms as possible so things can get cramped. Most rooms are going to be smaller than your average Holiday Inn in the US. There are hotels that were actually built as hotels, and they have comparable rooms, but in most cases your going to spend 300+ â‚¬ a night to stay there. I only mention this because I see a lot of people complaining about room size in reviews, in the US even a $45 motel room tends to be larger than than 150 â‚¬ room in Europe, but again, that's because motels were built as motels. Having said all that, my wife and I found our room at the Hotel St. Paul in Paris to quite spacious, not as big as a US motel room, but not tiny or cramped by any means. The bathroom was a normal size, not large, tub/shower combination, built in hair dryer was nice. We once spent a night at a London hotel with a shower so small my wife literally had to step out of the shower in order to pick up the bar of soap she had dropped (and my wife is not a large woman). We got a superior double room, we sprang for that expecting a little more space and were happy with what we got. The photos on the website really do represent actual rooms, you what you see which is not always the case. The bed was large and comfortable. We were on the street side which was noisy, there's a restaurant across the street, and a bar on either side of the hotel. It's not traffic noise it's people noise, Frenchmen singing American rock songs for instance. However, the windows were very soundproof when closed, the noise didn't bother us so we slept with them open. Either way the street noise wasn't a problem and the street itself is actually very quiet in the sense that its not busy. The service was excellent and very friendly. We were given an iron and an ironing board with a smile.The location was wonderful, it's a fantastic part of the city, and close to Metros, great restaurants, bars, and museums. We always keep our eyes open for different hotels when we walk around a city in case there's a better deal or the one we're staying in is booked in the future, and we didn't see a single hotel we would rather have stayed in. The price was good, you can get deals at this hotel. We got a 221â‚¬ room for 181â‚¬ booking online with a special internet price, and we got exactly what we expected. You can pay less in this part of the city but you may have a hotel adventure, i.e. a cramped room, and I mean cramped. My wife and I are no longer in our 20s and are not interested in hotel adventures so this was a very pleasant experience. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't on a really tight budget and wants to stay in a comfortable room in a great part of the city. If you want the same room and service for less you probably have to stay further out and commute in to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceyTurnip
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a weekend trip to see the Prix l'Arc de Triomphe. The hotel was recommended to me, and having read trip advisor I was confident that the hotel would be nice. We travelled on the RER from CDG, and the hotel was a short walk from the station. On arrival our room wasn't ready, so we ventured out for some lunch and pricey coffee. We had booked a superior room, which faced the front of the property overlooking the street. To be honest I had expected the room to be more spacious, as it was fairly expensive. The room was clean and nicely decorated with a four poster bed and small but modern bathroom. The reception staff could not have been more friendly or helpful assisting us with directions to Longchamp. The breakfast room is located in the basement, and to be honest we found nicer places to enjoy a croissant down towards Notre Dame. The hotel is next to Jardin du Luxembourg which we didn't have time to visit, but it may be worth checking events for the Jardin before booking. There was a Nuit Blanche event whilst we were staying, so along with the fact the hotel is near a uni, the streets were packed. Needless to say it was very noisy until around 5am. I really enjoyed this area of Paris, and if I was returning I would stay in this area, however I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Quaint hotel with superior service”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Weaver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hotel St. Paul on two different occasions and have found it to be a wonderful part of the Parisan experience. It small, only thiry some rooms, but they are all well decorated, clean and well presented. The hotel's location is excellent, a block from the Luxenbourg Gardens, five minutes to the Pantheon and the Sorbonne, only about five blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame and a half block from the l'Odeon. Metro stops and St Michel and l'Odeon are short walks (5-10 minutes) away and from there you can be literally anywhere in Paris in 20 to 30 minutes. The thing that sets the St. Paul apart from other nice small hotels in Paris is their front desk staff. They are more than willing to help with everything from directions and travel arrangement to getting you a reservation at a special little bistro for dinner. They have never missed with any of their recommendations they have given us. Staying at the St. Paul was a big addition to our Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, fresh little gem in a busy city, well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaReddog
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days in this charming little gem of a hotel in the midst of the bustling rive gauche area of Paris. It was delightfully decorated in fresh, warm colors. The staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants and arranging transportation to De Gaulle airport in the midst of busy travel times. They provide a nice B and B arrangement. We would recommend it to anyone wanting a pleasant stay in the midst of a busy city. Internet was available also.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect Paris hotel: great location, friendly, knowledgable staff, cozy.”
Reviews.Author: TrishDenver
Reviews.Content: We loved the St. Paul! Excellent location near Odeon and St. Michel Metro stops, could walk to major sites, museums, knowledgable, attentive, friendly staff, cozy room (although quite small, but that's Paris), air conditioning, and lovely breakfasts. Great neighborhood with good restaurants, shopping on St. Germaine Boulevard steps away. Would really like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable stay but pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Lovesanicehotel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, choosing the hotel on the basis of good reviews here and in guide books. The location was brilliant, in the beautiful and relaxed left bank part of the City, on a street with several restaurants and near to the metro. The reception on arrival was warm and friendly, and the reception area very nicely decorated. We read about the noise problems at the front of the building at the weekend - hardly surprising given the part of town it's in and it's proximity to a university - so booked one of the smaller rooms at the back. It did look out over a school yard but we did not find this to be a problem. The room was very small, with only a small strip around the bed and a small bathroom. We were a little disappointed as we have stayed in Paris before and although Paris rooms are known for their small size, we expected more for the expensive price that we were paying. Everywhere was clean and the bathroom was modern. The furniture was of an old style, so not to my personal taste but fine and the bed was comfortable. I would not recommend this place for a longer stay as the rooms are so small, but it was okay for a short break. I just expect a little more than 'okay' for that kind of money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , Great location”
Reviews.Author: coatesgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights ( 2 nights, then three nights two weeks later) at Hotel Saint Paul in July 2009. It has a great location in Saint Germain, quiet but really handy. The Odeon metro is a short walk away as is the Luxembourg metro which is on the RER line to CDG airport.It s close to many many restaurants and gorgeous shops. The rooms were a good size for Paris, very comfortable with a modern bathroom. The hotel has a small private hotel feel about it. The staff and the cat are lovely. We loved everything about the Saint Paul and will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “prime location, charming hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: grateful23
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in Hotel St. Paul. Great location in the 6th arrondissement both in terms of safety and walking access to mny tourist sites. Two Metro stops very close by. Extremely helpful, multilingual day time staff (they helped us get tickets to a concert while we were still in the States). Over night staff, however, a bit brusque. Daytime staff, though, more than make-up for the 'one bad apple' of the night time crew. We were able to take advantage of a buy 3, get a 4th night free promo so opted to get the room upgrade. It was well worth it as the rooms were spacious by Parisian standards. Kind of an odd half-glass shower that one should probably sit in. We loved the old-fashioned, spiral staircase but there's a small elevator if you'd prefer. Highly recommended. Note: in house breakfast offered in a charming vaulted, below ground room. Didn't actually eat there as it was 13 euros per person. We just grabbed stuff around the corner on our way to touring activities.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ArchieParis_France
Reviews.Content: Tremendous place! The most helpful staff in this city and friendly with it. Indeed nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Quiet location near the Luxembourg Gardens with loads of character plus our room on the top floor had double glazing to the opening windows and a view. What is it about the rooftops of Paris? Magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tagata
Reviews.Content: Wonderful welcoming hotel and staff. The location is great. The room i shared with my daughter was a little small but the beds are extremely comfortable (no backache as I have usually in hotels) and bathroom updated. Thank you Djamila for your patience to answer our so many questions. MÃªme aprÃ©s notre dÃ©part.!!! Merci beaucoup.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at this hotel and contributed to our wonderful week-end in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: FranEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel and feel that it was good value for money The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Our standard room was a good size with a lovely en-suite and was very clean and comfortable. It is near some wonderful restaurants - La Fernandaise and Les Papilles to name a few! Easy to get to by train - Ren B - from the airport and near Meto lines etc. It is also within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay etc. and Boulevards Saint Michel and Saint Germain. There is a lovely breakfast restaurant serving a french breakfast. Breakfast was not included in the price we paid but we were happy with that because we like to have different experiences and soak up the atmosphere of the city starting with breakfast! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel superb, from the position to service”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel was superb, from the position to the service. The staff were wonderful, very warm and welcoming from the start ,Djamila in particular was very friendly.This made a difference in our visit, especially as it was our first time in France. . The room was lovely,quiet at night so we could rest well. It looked recently rennovated with a pretty bathroom. Best of all was Sputnik, the cat, who was always curled up on a chair or near the reception desk. What a nice thing to come to after a long day of sightseeing! The hotel is walking distance from Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens, Odeon and Bulevard Saint Germaine...The hotel is in the 6th Arrondissment, which is the best that Paris can offer to the art and coffee lovers. Overall, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: dndtex
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights and were able to walk to everything we wanted to see in Paris - great location. The staff was friendly and very helpful with all our questions and requests. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to get to know Paris.on foot.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended, gem of a hotel in my favourite part of paris”
Reviews.Author: athenaUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint Paul is a gem of a hotel that I would definitely go back to whenever I am in Paris. It is a small hotel on a quiet street in the beautiful Latin Quarter, but within walking distance of Notre Dame and the Sorbonne as well as the metro. The rooms are immaculately clean and well appointed, lovely staff and delicious breakfasts. The best thing about the hotel is the wonderful cat, Sputnik, he gave us a warm greeting every morning. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel - I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly Hotel, perfectly placed for sightseeing and great restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Englandmodel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was charming, as were the lovely ladies behind the reception desk, aided by the wonderful hotel cat 'Sputnick' . The bedroom was beautifully decorated, spacious and clean. Very well placed for a variety of restaurants, our favourite being 'Le Bouillon Racine'. We would definately return to this adorable hotel. Hopefully very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ClovaTheWestie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily reached as it is close to a number of Metro Stops as well as being on the direct RER line from CDG airport. It is situated about 5 minutes from Jardin De Luxembourg in an area surrounded by decent bars, restaurants, bistros and bakeries. Compared with some other areas of Paris it feels quite affluent. The hotel is in a typical Parisian building on a fairly narrow street and is spread over 5 floors. The public reception area is very welcoming, neat and tidy and you are usually met by the friendly hotel cat, come manager! The staff are very friendly and had us checked in very quickly. We got an upgrade which is always worth an extra mark! The stairways to the rooms are narrow but there is a lift if you don't fancy the short climb to your room. We found our room to be modern and, for Paris, very spacious. The bed was comfortable with extra pillows and the room had 2 sets of large French windows opening out onto the street. The bathroom was also large for Paris and had the look of something that had been renovated fairly recently. If I had one complaint it would be that the room was exceptionally warm at nights and with the window open there was too much street noise to sleep comfortably. There was air conditioning but it was not on and we never asked for it to be switched on. The room has a television and a well stocked fridge as well as plenty of wardrobe space. Breakfast is a little expensive at 13 Euros but is of a good standard, served in the basement of the hotel. Overall I would highly recommend this place and will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Left Bank's most charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: thevagabond
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel! I first tried it out when it was recommended in the New York Times, and have never been disappointed. I arrived very late but Sputnik the cat was still overseeing guest check-in and woke from his nap long enough to give me a welcome nuzzle. Location is so convenient, close to the Luxembourg Gardens, the nightlife of the Latin Quarter, an easy walk to Notre Dame, the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay. Lots of great restaurants within a block or two. Staff is courteous and professional, and all the rooms are individually decorated by the caring owners. This is old Parisian charm and comfort that's hard to find anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family owned hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CarolineSWFrance
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a party of 8 people, including 2 children, for a friend's 70th birthday. I know Paris quite well and think that this is ideally placed to visit the city. The metro & bus stops are very close. My room was looking onto the road but was well insulated and so I was not troubled by any noise. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The big plus are the staff who go out of their way to be helpful and pleasant. They planned out 3 different journies acccross the city for me which made everything stress free. I will definately stay at this hotel again when I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: idish
Reviews.Content: Great location: plenty of restaurants cafes and bars in nearby Odeon square, walking distance to tourist attractions, convinient transportation. Nice quiet rooms (not too spacious, though). I skipped the breakfast - went to a nearby bakery instead.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy quiet respite from a busy city”
Reviews.Author: cycledallas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint-Paul was in a great location. We could walk everywhere..bookstores, Starbucks, many restaurants, ATM machines, etc. and there was a subway station a few blocks away. I was rather pricey, but so is everything in Paris these days. We loved our room. It was quiet, bright and private. The cat, Sputnik, was an adorable diversion at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Nundrum
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel St. Paul was ideal four our family foursome. We stayed in two different rooms there (before and after driving to Provence.) The first was barely large enough to contain the four beds, but we knew that going in, and really, who spends much of their time in Paris in their hotel room? If you are staying in a family room, I highly recommend requesting the one on the first floor near reception (Room 2). While it is not air-conditioned (which was a problem one night) it has an upper loft, and day beds on the lower level, giving room for a desk, TV, and sitting area. It was clean and bright, with comfortable bathroom/shower facilities, and fresh linen. It was also an enormous amount of space for the price in Paris. The location was ideal. The street is relatively quiet (and we were there during Fete de la Musique!) but very close to everything. Two blocks to Luxembourg Gardens for a morning run or an afternoon picnic. Convenient to bus (to Eiffel Tower), and Metro (everywhere else.) It is close enough to the river to be able to walk to the islands and the Louvre. And the neighborhood is very active, diverse, and full of cafes and brasseries for every budget and taste. My personal favorite was Boullion Racine, around the corner from the hotel. One downside, which we should have checked beforehand, was the 13 euro/pp breakfast offered by the hotel. Paying $80 US for four people to have croissants and coffee was a bit extreme. If you can find a package with this hotel that includes the breakfast, it is well worth it. Lastly, Monsieur Sputnik, the property's cat who serves as mascot and host, is one of the most amusing animals I've ever met. It was a very nice bonus to have a rent-a-pet included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LMNYC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation in Paris and although I have never written a review before I just had to write about the Hotel Saint Paul. The hotel is exceptional and I would highly recommend it to anyone. What made the hotel so wonderful were the staff...very warm and welcoming from the time we booked the hotel via e-mail throughout our stay (Djamila inparticular was very sweet and friendly). This made a difference in our visit, especially since we were new with the language and it was our first time in France. The staff always provided us with great information, directions and even restaurant recommendations. It almost felt like we were staying at a friend's home rather than a hotel b/c the people were so warm and friendly. I can't tell you what a difference that makes when compared to some of the larger, impersonal chain hotels. The room and hotel itself were lovely. We had a deluxe room facing the street and it was beautiful. Quiet at night so we could rest well. It looked recently rennovated with nice linens and a pretty bathroom. The lobby area was so quaint and inviting. Best of all was Sputnik the cat, who belonged to the hotel owner and was always curled up on a chair near the reception desk. What a nice thing to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel is walking distance to great pastry shops, Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens, which was also a plus. The hotel is in the 6th Arrondissment, which is a great area. Overall, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in St. Paul and Paris”
Reviews.Author: pjtex
Reviews.Content: April 14th to April 18th 2008. We didn't book the stay in Saint Paul ourselves; our trip to Paris was a present!!!! We stayed in St.Paul for 5 days. It was great from the beginning to the end! We arrived by the Thalys; going to the hotel with the metro from Gard du Nord to metro station Odeon was very easy; it took about 15 minutes. From the Odeon station you have to walk 5 minutes before you get to the hotel. Don't go to Paris by car!!!!! It's almost impossible to find a parking place and it's difficult to find the correct street. From beginning to the end everyone was most friendly in the hotel. So many beautiful details in the hotel!! Our room on the 5th floor was a very quiet. Every day clean towels and bedclothes. A bottle of Champage and chocolates was in the room on the day of arrival. Breakfast is very good with croissants, bread, fresh fruit, juices, tea, coffee, milk, cornflakes, etc. In the Quartier Latin you can visit so many restaurants!! It's difficult to choose one!!! There are so many terraces to sit and drink a glas of (French) wine and watch people. From the hotel you can walk to the Notre Dame. Take the Batobus (bootbus) on river the Seine to visit the Louvre, the Eifeltower, Saint Germain des Pres, d'Orsay museum, the Champs Elysee and the Hotel de Ville. Just a few minutes from the hotel you find the most beautiful park of Paris, Jardin du Luxembourg. From the Odeon station it takes about half an hour with the metro to get to Montmartre with the Sacre Coeur and the Place du Tetre. Visit the Moulin Rouge, the Dali museum. Take a walk in African area with hundreds of small stores and small markets. Don't forget to go to Le Marais ands visit the Centre Pompidou, the Place des Vosges and the Picasso museum. After a great day and evening in Paris it is so nice to arrive in the comfortable hotel St.Paul and sleep in the wonderful bed after taking a warm bath. Contact with people at home or finding information about Paris is very easy, because you can (free) use the internet in the hotel. Do you miss your cat at home?? There always is the hotelcat Spoetnik. We'll sure visit St.Paul again, because Paris is a wonderful city and hotel St. Paul is absolutely excellent !!! Two 50+ from the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “What is all the hype about?”
Reviews.Author: Rowan37
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend in November of last year after reading dozens of reviews of hotels in the Latin Quarter (we normally stay on the Right Bank but all of our favourite restaurants/bars are here). We were looking for a romantic, charming, well located hotel on the Left Bank and so we opted for this. The location is absolutely fine and the reception area is well presented and inviting, whilst the seating area to the right of the entrance is very comfortable with a modern fire place. However, I am confused why there is so much hype about this place. We asked to move rooms after being put in one of the "renovated" rooms on the top floor. I know Paris hotel rooms are renowned for being on the small side, but at this price I do not accept such an excuse. The room was small and dingy (if you step on tip toes you can see out of the window), and the toilet (no bath so I cannot call it a bathroom) was miniscule although it was fitted out to a modern standard. The second room we were shown to (on a lower floor) was much bigger, with two large windows. Again the decor of the bathroom (this one was spacious with a large bath) was modern and fresh. However, that contrasted markedly with the grim carpet and haggard old furniture (not rustic antique - the miss matching tables and chairs had always been cheap). The lighting was harsh (two long fluorescent strip lights on the far side wall give a less than warm hue to the tired blue painted room), so at nighttime you do not waste anymore time than is necessary getting ready to go out. It seems like renovation work is ongoing but the piecemeal fashion in which it is done means that rooms such as ours - new bathroom, old bedroom - are on the whole still pretty mediocre. Why not just fully renovate the room? The refurbished space only emphasizes how old and tatty the rest of the room is. We have stayed in Paris many times before and love everything about what is arguably the most beautiful and charming city in the world. This hotel (specifically our room) did nothing to add to the experience this time round, and given the price we were particularly disappointed. The previous time we stayed in Paris, we took a room at the Westin on the Right Bank in a gorgeous international standard room with unrivalled views of the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. Amazingly the nightly rate worked out virtually the same as this hotel! We were huge fans of the local area around this hotel and can completely understand why you would want to book a hotel in the Latin Quarter for your stay in Paris. However, if you are looking through Trip Advisor and still trying to decide whether to book this hotel, I would suggest you keep on looking - we still are.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulasue
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Saint Paul for 7 nights. I was very pleased with our accomodations and would recommend it to others. The hotel is on a side street and was extemely convenient to everything we wanted to see and do. Very clean! Although the room was small, it was completely adequate. I believe most rooms in Paris hotels are small so it was exactly what I expected. I would not recommend paying for the breakfast. Ours was included in the price of our stay, but I would have been disappointed if I would have paid extra. Not much choice and it was the same everyday. However, the wait staff was wonderful. Upon returning to Paris I would stay at this hotel again. It was a great place to rest our feet after a full day of sight-seeing. Wonderful vacation - can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: anthbike
Reviews.Content: Despite living in France for a year, and visiting on numerous occasions I'd never actually been to Paris before. So for a first visit I really wanted the hotel to live up to the promise of the city - and the Hotel Saint Paul Rive Gauche certainly did that. Right from the welcome at reception we knew things would be relaxed here. The hotel cat, Sputnik, lounging on the reception desk summed up the feel. If anything my only gripe came at this point, and it was nothing to do with the cat (who was fantastic), but rather that the receptionist spoke to us in English when I was speaking in French. Really a very minor complaint when her English was so good! Staying on the third floor we had a nicely sized room with a large and comfortable bed and a clean and modern bathroom. We weren't planning on spending too much time in the room, but it was nice to know that if we had to we'd be perfectly happy to hang about here. The location of the hotel was superb. 10-15 minutes walk from Notre Dame (and the excellent Shakespeare & Co) and with a wealth of great restaurants in the vicinity (most notably Polidor - two doors down from the hotel). Even the Eiffel Tower was only 15 minutes or so away by bike (there's a Velib station on Rue Vaugirard very near the hotel). I did have a worry with the hotel that there were a couple of bars on the street, but perhaps my British experience of these things took over as even with the window open during the night we weren't disturbed at all. This hotel just felt so comfortable and relaxed - we're already planning a return to Paris next year, and I already know where I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ElleGolightly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very enjoyable long weekend in Paris at the Hotel Saint Paul. Extremely pleasant and helpful staff on the front desk including Sputnik the cat! Hotel very well placed for the Metro (Opera station was a 5 minute walk down the street and the RER station from the airport was 5 minutes walk in the other direction.) Our room (No. 34) was on the third floor overlooking the street and was very pleasant. I suppose some people might regard the furniture as basic but the room was spotlessly clean, as was the marble bathroom. Yes, the bathroom was on the small side but we came to Paris to enjoy the city not spend time in the hotel room. We didn't breakfast at the hotel as there are a lot of cafes very close by where you can grab a croissant and a coffee. I really wouldn't recognise the hotel from the two previous poor reviews which are completely at odds with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: darrenzo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were extremely dissapointed with our stay at the Hotel Saint Paul. The room was incredibly small, with very basic furnishings, no set of drawers just one wardrobe for clothes, there wasn't even a small table which I can't understand as they offer breakfast in your room, but I guess you would have to lay it out on the bed! I found the room cold, we had to put the shower on for some heat. One evening I was so cold I rang reception and they said the heating was on (the radiator felt slightly warm) so he brought me a blanket. I liked the original beams but the room was tatty, tacky wallpaper scraped off the corners of the room, pipes running up the wall etc. If this was a cheap hotel we would have put up with that but we paid over Â£125 per night so we expected a little more for our money. The room opposite us was being re-furbished so when we wanted a lie down before going out for the evening it was impossible due to the drilling and banging, we rang reception and they assured us it was a temporary arrangement which was untrue as the guy was there the whole of the following day until after 8pm. On the last morning the maid walked into our room twice while we were changing I found this incredibly annoying, when I told the receptionist as we were checking out she didn't apologise just rang the maid and told her to do the rooms on another floor. Overall I loved the area of Saint Germain but would never book to stay here again, it's way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: edith94
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. We have visited Paris many times before and usually stayed in hotels on the right bank but as we tend to spend most of our time on the left bank we thought it made sense to book a hotel on the left bank this time. We definitely made the right decision to stay on the left bank but we were not so fortunate with our choice of hotel. After reading the extraordinary reviews on this site, we were confused as to whether we had actually turned up at the same hotel. There is rustic charm and then there is just plain dingy tatty dÃ©cor! The hotel lobby is indeed nicely decorated and looks very much as it does on the hotelâ€™s website. However, the welcome we received from the receptionist was far from friendly (in contrast to the lady who was on duty the following 2 days) and made worse when we had to request to move rooms as the first room we were shown had no window, only a small skylight in the roof and a bathroom that was so small you couldnâ€™t close the door whilst sitting on the toilet (I am not particularly tall). The second room we were offered was much bigger with 2 windows and a normal sized bathroom so we chose to stay in this room. However, it was far from ideal, the dÃ©cor in the rooms is very dated and shabby with poor lighting. At night with no natural light coming from outside, the room was very dingy and depressing â€“ we only spent a short time in the room in the evenings while getting ready to go out but it was long enough! The hotel is generally in need of refurbishment. The rooms on the top floor have been re-decorated and look a lot better as a result unfortunately these are also the rooms with no windows and a bathroom the size of a cupboard. The hotel is also very outdated with regard to fire safety regulationsâ€“ the only means of fire escape are the main stairs or tiny lift, not leaving you with many options if you are staying on one of the higher floors and these routes are blocked! Whilst I appreciate that the hotel is not expensive by Paris standards, it is by no means cheap and for an extra â‚¬50 a night you could stay in many hotels on the left bank that are of a much higher standard. All in all I found it a very disappointing experience and would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaGrover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the advice of several friends. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was INCREDIBLY helpful during my ENTIRE stay. The location allowed me to walk many of the important sites of Paris, and it was conveniently located near several Metro stations. The rooms were extremely clean, and the daily service was exceptional. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel With Character”
Reviews.Author: A2JetSet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2007. This is a typical Paris economy hotel. It's located in the 6th in a very old building; in fact, part of one wall is the Medieval wall that once surrounded the city. Typically tiny lift and stairwell and rooms. This is to be expected in a hotel of this class. We wanted a resonably-priced, well-located hotel with character and we got it. Easy (5-10 minute) walk to Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, Musee du Moyen-Age, Comptoir du Relais restaurant and several metro stops. Clean rooms, nice reception staff, decent European breakfast (optional). Did I mention it was reasonably-priced? NOT for those expecting a USA-type Holiday Inn, but then you're in Paris so why would you?

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mrfozzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 4 fantastic days in Paris to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, we spent some considerable time prior to travel reviewing hotels in the Latin Quarter area and found quite a few comments that were off putting, that is until we came across the reviews for the Saint Paul, too good to be true? Absolutely not, this hotel is a real home from home, we had a large room on the ground floor which was quiet, very clean and comfortable and had a great shower. The staff were couteous and most helpful (not forgetting Monsieur Sputnik the cat who will visit you to check you have settled in ok!) and made us feel very welcome. The buffet breakfast, although not cheap is plentiful and will set you up for for the days sightseeing. This hotel is situated in a quiet area close to numerous restaurants and bars and is in walking distance of many of the main Paris sights, for further afield we recommend the bus service which we found very efficient and easy to find your way around the city. A word of warning, if you intend to visit the Latin Quarter in September, book early as for some reason we found a lot of hotels were full, as was the Saint Paul but fortunately (for us) they had a cancelation.There is something about this hotel that makes you feel relaxed as soon as you walk in, we have taken away some fantastic memories and thoroughly recommend it and will be definitely return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, wonderful!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFlowers50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked another Hotel, but after reading the reviews we decided to look for another, We were so overwhelmed by all the Hotels so we decided to pick an area in Paris we wanted to stay in and go from there, well after reading alot of reviews we came across the Hotel St.-Paul and decided it sounded just Wonderful, so we booked it and I must say we were still a little unsure, of our choice since its so hard to select something site unseen, but I have to say from the very first moment we set foot in the Hotel it was wonderful, its a small quaint little Hotel in a Great section of Paris, Our room faced the front and the room was a good size, and VERY CLEAN, the Bathroom was very nice and lots of HOT water, we didn't make it to the Breakfast room, but I did have the Continental Breakfast for room service and it was so nice and there was alot of items fruit, bread and cheese and yogart and wonderful coffee, and Juice. The Staff was ALWAYS very helpful and so nice, and "Sputnick" the Cat was always there to greet us, I fell in love with Paris and with this Hotel, I know you will too! I came for my 50th Birthday and it couldn't have been more Perfact. I would love to return to Paris and when I do I will stay here again, with out a doubt. S. Flowers

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Gem-”
Reviews.Author: sunnyalbertan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 nights at the Hotel St. Paul and found it to be a great hotel in a perfect location. It is charming, clean and safe with personable and helpful staff at all times. The room was spotless and we found the beds very comfortable. The bathroom was large and hot water was always readily available. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access and there is no charge for phone calls. Both great conveniences and money savers. The hotel is located in a great area - easy walking distance to great but not expensive restaurants, museums, gardens and shops. The Odeon metro station is only a block away which was a convenient way to get anywhere in the city. But, we also found that walking was a gret way to expereince Paris and this hotel provides a great location to access all directions easily. We found the hotel and neighborhood very quiet at night and yet only a 2-3 minute walk from the bars and restaurants that were "alive" until the early morning. There is a train agency 5 minutes away in the event you are looking to travel outside of Paris. We are Canadian and visited the Vimy Ridge memorial outside the town of Arras. Paris is full of "wow" moments but this is a day trip worth taking if you have the time. There are so many sights to see in Paris. We had full sightseeing days and most nights we would return to the hotel to change our clothes before heading out for dinner. You have to leave your large key at the front desk when leaving the hotel. This guarantees that you won't lose your key and you will always be greeted with a friendly bonjour or bonsoir.The staff always had good suggestions and proper directions. You will not be disappointed in this hotel. We will be recommneding it to our friends, although we would be more than happy to keep it our little secret!
